title: Deceased Estate Sold Within Two Years

scenario_info.name: Deceased Estate Sold Within Two Years
scenario_info.description: William's mother passes away and leaves him her home, which was her main residence. William sells the property within 2 years of her death. Because the property was the deceased's main residence and was sold within 2 years, William is entitled to a full CGT exemption under the deceased estate provisions.
applicable_rules: Property was deceased's main residence at time of death
Sold within 2 years = Full exemption (regardless of whether beneficiary lived there)
William did not need to move in to claim exemption
Note: If sold after 2 years, partial exemption may apply

property_history.description: Mother's original purchase - was her main residence
Mother passes away. Property was her main residence. Inherited by William.
William receives property as beneficiary. Property left vacant.

properties.notes: Full CGT exemption under 2-year disposal rule. Property was mother's main residence and sold within 2 years of death (688 days). William never lived there but still qualifies for full exemption.

user_query: I inherited my mother's home when she passed away in March 2023. It was her main residence. I never lived there but I'm selling it now in February 2025. What's my CGT liability?
